We explore the reflection and transmission characteristics of a system composed of two whispering-gallery mode resonators.
Each resonator contains a Zeeman split quantum dot and side-couples

In summary, we have demonstrated the UR and
UT properties in a system consisting of two WGM
resonators embedded with a Zeeman split QD,
respectively, and indirectly coupled through an
optical fiber. Research results show that the positions of low reflection peaks exhibit periodic red
shifts with the increasing phase shift
shifts with the increasing phase shift θ and intersect with the low transmission peaks simultaneously when phase shift θ = π. In other words,
both UR and UT can be achieved when
In addition, UR and UT can be manipulated by

[6] Zhong-Ming Gu, Jie Hu, Bin Liang, XinYe Zou, and Jian-Chun Cheng.
we prefer to utilize it as a means of switching
between UR and UT. We also investigate the
WGM resonator on reflection and transmission,
and identify the specific range in which UR and
UT can occur simultaneously. In brief, the system
has the capability to dynamically regulate photon
transport, and it could potentially inspire the advancements in quantum optical devices such as
isolators, circulators, routers and so on.
